snippet: With an estimated 50 tons of trash left behind by climbers littering Mount Everest, Nepal declared that all climbers must carry down 18 pounds of garbage or face stiff penalties.
abstract: Nepal's tourism authority declares that those climbing Mount Everest must return from trip with an extra 18 pounds of garbage; rule is government's first concerted effort to eliminate estimated 50 tons of trash that have been left on Mount Everest over the past six decades.
lead_paragraph: With an estimated 50 tons of trash left behind by climbers littering Mount Everest, Nepal declared that all climbers must carry down 18 pounds of garbage or face stiff penalties.

headline.main: Climbing Mt. Everest? Nepal Says Bring Back Garbage
headline.print_headline: Nepal: Why Pick Up Everest’s Trash? Because It’s There
